intro: Commiphora chiovendana, commonly known as the Socotra cinnamomum, is a unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, aromatic resinous exudate. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, with thick, leathery leaves and a slow growth rate. Its botanical features include a complex root system and a unique morphology adapted to the arid environment of its native habitat.
